intro: Elatostema imbricans, commonly known as the overlapping leaf plant, is a member of the Urticaceae family, characterized by its unique leaf arrangement. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish-white and clustered in inflorescences. Elatostema imbricans is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests or along stream banks.
